text: SAO PAULO, Aug 12 Brazilian retailer Magazine Luiza SA reported on Thursday a second-quarter adjusted profit of 89 million reais ($16.93 million), swinging back from a loss in the same period a year ago, helped by strong brick-and-mortar sales.The companys adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) went up 209% to 455.4 million reais. (Reporting by Aluisio Alves; Writing by Jimin Kang; Editing by Chris Reese)
